00013 #ifndef __AFCGI_H__
00014 #define __AFCGI_H__

00016 #include <events.h>

00018 #define FCGI_HEADER_LEN  8
00019 
00020 /** The names of the different callbacks */
00021 enum afcgi_callback_names {
00022         ON_HEADERS = 0,
00023         ON_RECEIVE,
00024         ON_RUN,
00025         ON_ABORT
00026 };
00027 
00028 struct ev_timeout_basic_node tm;
00029 
00030 struct afcgi_sess;
00031 
00032 typedef void (*afcgi_cb)(struct afcgi_sess *s, void *arg);
00033 
00034 struct afcgi_binder {
00035         int fd;
00036         void *arg;
00037         afcgi_cb on_new;
00038 };
00039 
00040 struct afcgi {
00041         int fd;
00042         int s;
00043         struct { // current header
00044                 uint8_t  version;
00045                 uint8_t  type;
00046                 uint16_t request_id;
00047                 uint16_t content_len;
00048                 uint8_t  padding_len;
00049                 uint8_t  reserved;
00050         } c;
00051         char *head;
00052         char buffer[1<<16];
00053         char *buff;
00054         int buff_len;
00055         struct afcgi_binder *binder;
00056         char tb[24];
00057 };
00058 
00059 struct afcgi_hdr {
00060         char *name;
00061         int name_len;
00062         char *value;
00063         int value_len;
00064         struct afcgi_hdr *next;
00065 };
00066 
00067 struct afcgi_sess {
00068         uint16_t request_id;
00069         struct {
00070                 uint16_t role;
00071                 uint8_t  flags;
00072                 uint8_t  reserved[5];
00073         } h;
00074         char *head;
00075         struct afcgi_hdr *hdr;
00076 
00077         // call backs
00078         void *arg;
00079         afcgi_cb on_headers;
00080         afcgi_cb on_receive;
00081         afcgi_cb on_run;
00082         afcgi_cb on_abort;
00083 };
00084 
00085 /**
00086  * set easy argument
00087  * @param s fascgi session identifier
00088  * @param arg easy argument
00089  */
00090 static inline void afcgi_set_arg(struct afcgi_sess *s, void *arg) { s->arg = arg; }
00091 
00092 /**
00093  * set callback
00094  * @param sess fascgi session identifier
00095  * @param name callback name
00096  * @param cb calback pointer
00097  */
00098 #define afcgi_set_callback(sess, name, cb) afcgi_set_cb_ ## name(sess, cb)
00099 
00100 static inline void afcgi_set_cb_ON_HEADERS(struct afcgi_sess *s, afcgi_cb cb){
00101         s->on_headers = cb;
00102 }
00103 static inline void afcgi_set_cb_ON_RECEIVE(struct afcgi_sess *s, afcgi_cb cb){
00104         s->on_receive = cb;
00105 }
00106 static inline void afcgi_set_cb_ON_RUN(struct afcgi_sess *s, afcgi_cb cb){
00107         s->on_run = cb;
00108 }
00109 static inline void afcgi_set_cb_ON_ABORT(struct afcgi_sess *s, afcgi_cb cb){
00110         s->on_abort = cb;
00111 }
00112 
00113 /**
00114  * init fcgi internals and poller system
00115  * @param maxconn The maximun of connection expected (all sockets)
00116  *                -1: use the max limit (ulimit -n)
00117  *                >0: use this value, ans set limit
00118  */
00119 void afcgi_init(int maxconn);
00120 
00121 /**
00122  * Bind network address or socket 
00123  * @param bind   network address or socket (or NULL for stdin)
00124  * @param on_new callback called for new connexion
00125  * @param arg    easy arg 
00126  * @return if ok return 0, else return < 0
00127  */
00128 int afcgi_bind(char *bind, afcgi_cb on_new, void *arg);
00129 
00130 /**
00131  * afcgi main loop. This launched the main loop after initialization
00132  * @param loop (boolean) 0: the function return,
00133  *                       1: the function never return
00134  */
00135 void afcgi_loop(int loop);
